intro: Pegaeophyton scapiflorum var. pilosicalyx, commonly known as the silky-stemmed clubmoss, is a rare and ancient plant belonging to the family Lepidoziaceae. It is characterized by its slender, branched stems covered in a dense layer of silky, scale-like structures. The plant produces small, club-shaped sporangia that are clustered in whorls along the stems. It thrives in moist, shaded environments, typically found in temperate regions with high humidity. Due to its unique morphology and evolutionary significance, it is of interest to botanists studying early land plant evolution.
